summary: The Maghreb is a region in western North Africa, including Algeria, Libya, Mauritania, Morocco, and Tunisia. It's also known as the Arab Maghreb or Northwest Africa. The area has a rich history, with various empires and kingdoms ruling over time, including the Romans, Berbers, and Arabs. In the 19th and 20th centuries, European countries like France and Spain controlled parts of the Maghreb. Today, these countries are independent but have had tensions over the Western Sahara dispute, which has slowed down their cooperation efforts through the Arab Maghreb Union.
title: Maghreb
